1st month: When lying on his tummy, he lifts his head
1 month: Relaxes when you take her in your arms
1st month: Looks at you as you smile and talk to him
1st month: Makes sounds
1st month: Opens and closes his fist when you gently touch
1st month: Moves her arms and legs freely on both sides
1st month: Gets excited when you talk to him
2nd month: Makes different sounds when she is happy, upset or hungry
2nd month: Gurgles, makes sounds
2nd month: Turns her head towards the sound source and shows that she is listening
2nd month: Follows the movement of things and people with her eyes
2nd month: Makes fine movements with his arms and legs
2nd month: When on her tummy, the baby is leaning on her forearms against the mat
2nd month: Turns her head to one side, then to the other
2nd month: Occasionally she keeps her fists open, manipulates them
2nd month:  Can comfort herself for a while
3rd and 4th months: Puts hands in the mouth
3rd and 4th months: Starts babbling
3rd and 4th months: Begins to mimic facial movements and expressions, as well as sounds during play
3rd and 4th months: Shows that she is angry or happy
3rd and 4th months: Carefully observes people's faces
3rd and 4th months: Reaches for a toy with one hand, explores it, shakes it and hits it
3rd and 4th months: Follows with his eyes a toy moving from one side to the other
3rd and 4th months:  Laughs at a human face
3rd and 4th months: Establishes hand eye coordination
5th and 6th months: Loudly expresses dissatisfaction or joy
5th and 6th months: Responds to the sound of the voice by making sounds   by merging vowels a, e, u
5th and 6th months: Rolls from the tummy to the back and from the back to the tummy over both sides
5th and 6th months: Reaches for things that are out of reach with one hand, and when she grasps them, she can move them from one hand to another
5th and 6th months: Explores things by putting them in his mouth
5th and 6th months: The baby is excited when he realizes that it`s time to play
7th to 9th months: Reacts when he hears own name
7th to 9th months: Babbles, makes syllables and produces many different sounds
7th to 9th months: Still puts objects in his mouth
7th to 9th months: Can sit up on her own and sit without support
7th to 9th months: Pushes away, tries to stand up
7th to 9th months: Begins to understand the meaning of the word NO
7th to 9th months: Begins to communicate with movements
7th to 9th months: Lifts himself up to a crawling position, some children are already crawling
7th to 9th months: Follows the falling object and looks for the hidden object
7th to 9th months: Smoothly transfers objects from hand to hand, shakes them
7th to 9th months: Gets upset when the parent leaves the room and relaxes when the parent returns
10th to 12th months: Imitates and uses gestures
10th to 12th months: Shows shyness and nervousness in communicating with strangers
10th to 12th months: Repeats syllables, and some children can already say words with the meaning
10th to 12th months: Picks small objects with her fingers, feeds with her fingers
10th to 12th months: Understands a brief instruction or order
10th to 12th months: Understands her name, names of familiar persons, objects from her environment
10th to 12th months: Spontaneously seeks to share interests and pleasures with adults
10th to 12th months: Stands up by holding onto to the furniture and starts walking next to it
10th to 12th months: Curiously examines toys, shakes them, bangs, throws, pays attention to details
13th to 18th months: Understands and executes simple orders
13th to 18th months: Plays Pretend games, Pretend play appears
13th to 18th months: Looks forward to joint activities
13th to 18th months: Puts one item into another
13th to 18th months: Stands, moves and walks independently
13th to 18th months: In communication, uses gestures for better mutual understanding
13th to 18th months: Knows how to use items for everyday use
13th to 18th months: Scribbles independently with a pencil or crayons on paper
19 to 24th months: Associates sounds with animals
19th to 24th months: In communication with people, uses a combination of words and gestures
19th to 24th months: Can go up and down the stairs
19th to 24th months: Play simple pretending games
19th to 24th months: Plays side by side with other children
19th to 24th months: Imitates the behaviour of adults and older children
19th to 24th months: Can stand on his toes, run, jump, kick the ball
19th to 24th months: Uses toys purposefully
19th to 24th months: Scribbles independently on paper
19th to 24th months: Uses one hand more
25th to 36th months: Finds it easier to separate from parents
25th to 36th months: Understands complex words
25th to 36th months: Turns pages of picture books by himself
25th to 36th months: Climbs up and down stairs
25th to 36th months: Can say a sentence of 2 to 3 words
25th to 36th months: Shows a wide range of emotions, recognizes emotions in others
25th to 36th months: Copies circles with a pencil, wooden or wax crayon
25th to 36th months: Develops a complex play and involves others in it
25th to 36th months: Follows the instructions that contain two or three orders
3rd and 4th months: Keeps head upright, without head support
10th to 12th months: Puts things in a box and takes them out of it
13th to 18th months: Pronounces words with meaning
2 months: Shows boredom or cries if activity does not change
25th to 36th months: Likes to play in the company of children
